name: MedaBots: Metabee
description:
Welcome to the world of MedaBots. MetaBots are robots that can have various parts upgraded and swapped to change and improve them. These parts can be purchased, or can be received as the spoils of battle if you win.

Enter your character... a boy who loves MedaBots. Sent to the store to get Spice-A-Roni, he ends up with a MedaBot instead. From this point on, his life is thrown into Robattles with other MedaBots.

MedaBots are made up of a basic body (male or female), four main parts (head, legs, right arm, and left arm), and a medal. The medal is what powers the MedaBot. All these parts can be changed. And because each part has multiple properties, you don't really "upgrade" your MedaBot... you just change it. Sometimes you will want a powerful weapon attack, sometimes you may want a less powerful weapon attack that can do Chain Damage or Status Damage.

When you battle, you take turns based on the speed your MedaBot can reach the center of the field. After it attacks, you hurry back to the outside and then return to the center. This is really just a timer thing to show how the speed of your MedaBot is affecting the attack speeds.

Your attack can damage the various parts of the other MedaBot(s) as long as it hits. Destroying a part will prevent the MedaBot from attacking with that part. Destroying the head will give you a victory even if you destroy nothing else. However, you cannot aim at each part. The defense rating of each part helps determine what is hit first.

Follow the story as you gain experience and level up your MedaBot's medal to gain more powerful attacks, better aim, etc. Get more bodies and medals for MedaBots so you can battle with up to 3-on-3 battles.

shot.caption: Your very own MedaBot story unfolds now...
The intro sequence shows your first MedaBot
Your first view of 4 new elemental MedaBots
The "MedaBots Weekly" television show gives you information on using MedaBots
The main part of any MedaBot is the body
The faces of each character is varied and can be quite funny
The menu shows the main things you can choose to look at
Your MedaWatch allows you to view all information about your MedaBot(s)
Your MedaBot information includes data on the various parts that are attached to it
Medals are what powers the MedaBots... without them, your MedaBot cannot function
The Medals can be leveled up and can get improved stats in these areas
You can view detailed information on each MedaPart that you can attach to your MedaBot
Abilities that are not attacks are shown on the battlefield screen
Attacks themselves are shown in full screen.  This is the launching of my Rocket attack
Each part shows the amount of damage received.  If it reaches 0, it is no longer functional
Some attacks produce Status Effects on the other player
Here, you can see the opponent taking damage in the Woods
This is a Chain Gun attack in the mountains that are covered in fog
You defeat your opponent when the MedaBot no longer functions
The defeat of your opponent.  In this case, it is your friend, Erika
Winning battles gets you new MedaParts
A powerful attack that happens without you doing anything... What could it be?
What a use for a MedaBot!
You really should stay out of the girls' bathroom
Visit the store to buy or sell MedaParts
The store holds various MedaParts for you to purchase
Everyone meets!  From the left, you have Koji with his sister Karin in the center.  Then you have Erika and you on the right (you think Karin is cute, btw)
Ugh! How'd you ever get talked into wearing a skirt?!
The Town Map
The Item list shows any items you have
